questions.text:
#### Q1. To cache your entire site for an application in Django, you add all except which of these settings?

- %OPTION% django.middleware.common.CommonMiddleware
- %OPTION% django.middleware.cache.UpdateCacheMiddleware
- %OPTION% django.middleware.cache.FetchFromCacheMiddleware
- %OPTION% django.middleware.cache.AcceleratedCacheMiddleware

#### Q2. In which programming language is Django written?

- %OPTION% C++
- %OPTION% Java
- %OPTION% Python
- %OPTION% Ruby

#### Q3. To automatically provide a value for a field, or to do validation that requires access to more than a single field, you should override the `___` method in the `___` class.

- %OPTION% validate(); Model
- %OPTION% group(); Model
- %OPTION% validate(); Form
- %OPTION% clean(); Field

#### Q4. A client wants their site to be able to load "Rick & Morty" episodes by number or by title—e.g., shows/3/3 or shows/picklerick. Which URL pattern do you recommend?

- %OPTION% <span>

```
url(r'shows/<int:season>/<int:episode>/', views.episode_number),
url(r'shows/<slug:episode_name>/', views.episode_name)
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
path('shows/<int:season>/<int:episode>/', views.episode_number),
path(r'shows/<slug:episode_name>/', views.episode_name)
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
path('shows/<int:season>/<int:episode>', views.episode_number),
path(r'shows/<slug:episode_name>/', views.episode_number)
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
url(r'^show/(?P<season>[0-9]+)/(?P<episode>[0-9]+)/$', views.episode_number),
url(r'^show/(?P<episode_name>[\w-]+)/', views.episode_name
```

#### Q5. How do you determine at startup time if a piece of middleware should be used?

- %OPTION% Raise MiddlewareNotUsed in the **init** function of your middleware.
- %OPTION% Implement the not_used method in your middleware class.
- %OPTION% List the middleware beneath an entry of django.middleware.IgnoredMiddleware.
- %OPTION% Write code to remove the middleware from the settings in [app]/**init**.py.

#### Q6. How do you turn off Django’s automatic HTML escaping for part of a web page?

- %OPTION% Place that section between paragraph tags containing the autoescape=off switch.
- %OPTION% Wrap that section between { percentage mark autoescape off percentage mark} and {percentage mark endautoescape percentage mark} tags.
- %OPTION% Wrap that section between {percentage mark autoescapeoff percentage mark} and {percentage mark endautoescapeoff percentage mark} tags.
- %OPTION% You don't need to do anything—autoescaping is off by default.

#### Q7. Which step would NOT help you troubleshoot the error "django-admin: command not found"?

- %OPTION% Check that the bin folder inside your Django directory is on your system path.
- %OPTION% Make sure you have activated the virtual environment you have set up containing Django.
- %OPTION% Check that you have installed Django.
- %OPTION% Make sure that you have created a Django project.

#### Q8. Every time a user is saved, their quiz_score needs to be recalculated. Where might be an ideal place to add this logic?

- %OPTION% template
- %OPTION% model
- %OPTION% database
- %OPTION% view

#### Q9. What is the correct way to begin a class called "Rainbow" in Python?

- %OPTION% Rainbow {}
- %OPTION% export Rainbow:
- %OPTION% class Rainbow:
- %OPTION% def Rainbow:

#### Q10. You have inherited a Django project and need to get it running locally. It comes with a requirements.txt file containing all its dependencies. Which command should you use?

- %OPTION% django-admin startproject requirements.txt
- %OPTION% python install -r requirements.txt
- %OPTION% pip install -r requirements.txt
- %OPTION% pip install Django

#### Q11. Which best practice is NOT relevant to migrations?

- %OPTION% To make sure that your migrations are up to date, you should run updatemigrations before running your tests.
- %OPTION% You should back up your production database before running a migration.
- %OPTION% Your migration code should be under source control.
- %OPTION% If a project has a lot of data, you should test against a staging copy before running the migration on production.

#### Q12. What will this URL pattern match? url(r'^\$', views.hello)

- %OPTION% a string beginning with the letter Ra string beginning with the letter R
- %OPTION% an empty string at the server root
- %OPTION% a string containing ^ and $a string containing ^ and $
- %OPTION% an empty string anywhere in the URLan empty string anywhere in the URL

#### Q13. What is the typical order of an HTTP request/response cycle in Django?

- %OPTION% URL > view > template
- %OPTION% form > model > view
- %OPTION% template > view > model
- %OPTION% URL > template > view > model

#### Q14. Django's class-based generic views provide which classes that implement common web development tasks?

- %OPTION% concrete
- %OPTION% thread-safe
- %OPTION% abstract
- %OPTION% dynamic

#### Q15. Which skills do you need to maintain a set of Django templates?

- %OPTION% template syntax
- %OPTION% HTML and template syntax
- %OPTION% Python, HTML, and template syntax
- %OPTION% Python and template syntax

#### Q16. How would you define the relationship between a star and a constellation in a Django model?

- %OPTION% <span>

```
class Star(models.Model):
name = models.CharField(max_length=100)
class Constellation(models.Model):
stars = models.ManyToManyField(Star)
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
class Star(models.Model):
constellation = models.ForeignKey(Constellation, on_delete=models.CASCADE)
class Constellation(models.Model):
stars = models.ForeignKey(Star, on_delete=models.CASCADE)
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
class Star(models.Model):
name = models.CharField(max_length=100)
class Constellation(models.Model):
stars = models.OneToManyField(Star)
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
class Star(models.Model):
constellation = models.ManyToManyField(Constellation)
class Constellation(models.Model):
name = models.CharField(max_length=100)
```

#### Q17. Which is NOT a valid step in configuring your Django 2.x instance to serve up static files such as images or CSS?

- %OPTION% In your urls file, add a pattern that includes the name of your static directory.
- %OPTION% Create a directory named static inside your app directory.
- %OPTION% Create a directory named after the app under the static directory, and place static files inside.
- %OPTION% Use the template tag {percentage mark load static percentage mark}.

#### Q18. What is the correct way to make a variable available to all of your templates?

- %OPTION% Set a session variable.
- %OPTION% Use a global variable.
- %OPTION% Add a dictionary to the template context.
- %OPTION% Use RequestContext.

#### Q19. Should you create a custom user model for new projects?

- %OPTION% No. Using a custom user model could break the admin interface and some third-party apps.
- %OPTION% Yes. It is easier to make changes once it goes into production.
- %OPTION% No. Django's built-in models.User class has been tried and tested—no point in reinventing the wheel.
- %OPTION% Yes, as there is no other option.

#### Q20. You want to create a page that allows editing of two classes connected by a foreign key (e.g., a question and answer that reside in separate tables). What Django feature can you use?

- %OPTION% actions
- %OPTION% admin
- %OPTION% mezcal
- %OPTION% inlines

#### Q21. Why are QuerySets considered "lazy"?

- %OPTION% The results of a QuerySet are not ordered.
- %OPTION% QuerySets do not create any database activity until they are evaluated.
- %OPTION% QuerySets do not load objects into memory until they are needed.
- %OPTION% Using QuerySets, you cannot execute more complex queries.

#### Q22. You receive a `MultiValueDictKeyError` when trying to access a request parameter with the following code: request.GET['search_term']. Which solution will NOT help you in this scenario?

- %OPTION% Switch to using POST instead of GET as the request method.
- %OPTION% Make sure the input field in your form is also named "search_term".
- %OPTION% Use MultiValueDict's GET method instead of hitting the dictionary directly like this: request.GET.get('search_term', '').
- %OPTION% Check if the search_term parameter is present in the request before attempting to access it.

#### Q23. Which function of Django's Form class will render a form's fields as a series of

tags? - %OPTION% show_fields() - %OPTION% as_p() - %OPTION% as_table() - %OPTION% fields()

#### Q24. You have found a bug in Django and you want to submit a patch. Which is the correct procedure?

- %OPTION% Fork the Django repository GitHub.
- %OPTION% Submit a pull request.
- %OPTION% all of these answers.
- %OPTION% Run Django's test suite.

#### Q25. Django supplies sensible default values for settings. In which Python module can you find these settings?

- %OPTION% django.utils.default_settings.py
- %OPTION% django.utils.global_settings.py
- %OPTION% django.conf.default_settings.py
- %OPTION% django.conf.global_settings.py

#### Q26. Which variable name is best according to PEP 8 guidelines?

- %OPTION% numFingers
- %OPTION% number-of-Fingers
- %OPTION% number_of_fingers
- %OPTION% finger_num

#### Q27. A project has accumulated 500 migrations. Which course of action would you pursue?

- %OPTION% Manually merge your migration files to reduce the number
- %OPTION% Don't worry about the number
- %OPTION% Try to minimize the number of migrations
- %OPTION% Use squashmigrations to reduce the number

#### Q28. What does an F() object allow you when dealing with models?

- %OPTION% perform db operations without fetching a model object
- %OPTION% define db transaction isolation levels
- %OPTION% use aggregate functions more easily
- %OPTION% build reusable QuerySets

#### Q29. Which is not a Django filed type for integers?

- %OPTION% SmallIntegerField
- %OPTION% NegativeIntegerField
- %OPTION% BigAutoField
- %OPTION% PositiveIntegerField

#### Q30. Which will show the currently installed version?

- %OPTION% print (django.version)
- %OPTION% import django django.getVersion()
- %OPTION% import django django.get_version()
- %OPTION% python -c django --version

#### Q31. You should use the http method `___` to read data and `___` to update or create data

- %OPTION% READ; WRITE
- %OPTION% GET; POST
- %OPTION% POST; GET
- %OPTION% GET; PATCH

#### Q32. When should you employ the POST method over GET for submitting data?

- %OPTION% when efficiency is important
- %OPTION% when you want the data to be cached
- %OPTION% when you want to use your browser to help with debugging
- %OPTION% when the data in the form may be sensitive

#### Q33. When to use the Django sites framework?

- %OPTION% if your single installation powers more than one site
- %OPTION% if you need to serve static as well as dynamic content
- %OPTION% if you want your app have a fully qualified domain name
- %OPTION% if you are expecting more than 10.000 users

#### Q34. Which infrastructure do you need:

`title=models.charfield(max_length=100, validators=[validate_spelling])`

- %OPTION% inizialized array called validators
- %OPTION% a validators file containing a function called validate_spelling imported at the top of model
- %OPTION% a validators file containing a function called validate imported at the top of model
- %OPTION% spelling package imported at the top of model

#### Q35. What decorator is used to require that a view accepts only the get and head methods?

- %OPTION% require_safe()
- %OPTION% require_put()
- %OPTION% require_post()
- %OPTION% require_get()

#### Q36. How would you define the relation between a book and an author - book has only one author.

- %OPTION% <span>

```
class Author (models.model):
book=models.foreignkey(Book,on_delete=models.cascade)
class Book(models.model):
name=models.charfield(max_length=100)
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```python
class Author (models.model):
name=models.charfield(max_length=100)
class Book(models.model):
author=models.foreignkey(Author,on_delete=models.cascade)
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
class Author (models.model):
name=models.charfield(max_length=100)
class Book(models.model):
author=models.foreignkey(Author)
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
class Author (models.model):
name=models.charfield(max_length=100)
class Book(models.model):
author=models.foreignkey(Author,on_delete=models.cascade)
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
class Author (models.model):
name=models.charfield(max_length=100)
class Book(models.model):
author=Author.name
```

#### Q37. What is a callable that takes a value and raises an error if the value fails?

- %OPTION% validator
- %OPTION% deodorizer
- %OPTION% mediator
- %OPTION% regular expression

#### Q38. To secure an API endpoint, making it accessible to registered users only, you can replace the rest_framework.permissions.allowAny value in the default_permissions section of your settings.py to

- %OPTION% rest_framework.permissions.IsAdminUser
- %OPTION% rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated
- %OPTION% rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthorized
- %OPTION% rest_framework.permissions.IsRegistered

#### Q39. Which command would you use to apply a migration?

- %OPTION% makemigration
- %OPTION% update_db
- %OPTION% applymigration
- %OPTION% migrate

#### Q40. Which type of class allows QuerySets and model instances to be converted to native Python data types for use in APIs?

- %OPTION% objectwriters
- %OPTION% serializers
- %OPTION% picklers
- %OPTION% viewsets

#### Q42. Which code block will create a serializer?

```
from rest_framework import serializers
from .models import Planet
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
class PlanetSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
class Meta:
model=Planet
fields=('name','position', 'mass', 'rings')
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
from rest_framework import serializers
from .models import Planet
class PlanetSerializer():
class Meta:
fields=('name','position', 'mass', 'rings')
model=Planet
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
from django.db import serializers
from .models import Planet
class PlanetSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
fields=('name','position', 'mass', 'rings')
model=Sandwich
```

- %OPTION% <span>

```
from django.db import serializers
from .models import Planet
class PlanetSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
class Meta:
fields=('name')
model=Planet
```

#### Q43. Which class allows you to automatically create a Serializer class with fields and validators that correspond to your model's fields?

- %OPTION% ModelSerializer
- %OPTION% Model
- %OPTION% DataSerializer
- %OPTION% ModelToSerializer

#### Q44. Which command to access the built-in admin tool for the first time?

- %OPTION% django-admin setup
- %OPTION% django-admin runserver
- %OPTION% python manage.py createuser
- %OPTION% python manage.py createsuperuser

#### Q45. Virtual environments are for managing dependencies. Which granularity works best?

- %OPTION% you should set up a new virtualenv for each Django project
- %OPTION% They should not be used
- %OPTION% Use the same venv for all your Django work
- %OPTION% Use a new venv for each Django app

#### Q46. What executes various Django commands such as running a webserver or creating an app?

- %OPTION% migrate.py
- %OPTION% wsgi.py
- %OPTION% manage.py
- %OPTION% runserver

#### Q47. What do Django best practice suggest should be "fat"?

- %OPTION% models
- %OPTION% controllers
- %OPTION% programmers
- %OPTION% clients

#### Q48. Which is not part of Django's design philosophy?

- %OPTION% Loose Coupling
- %OPTION% Less Code
- %OPTION% Fast Development
- %OPTION% Implicit over explicit

#### Q49. What is the result of this template code?

{{"live long and prosper"|truncate:3}}

- %OPTION% live long and ...
- %OPTION% live long and
- %OPTION% a compilation error
- %OPTION% liv

#### Q50. When does this code load data into memory?

```
1 sandwiches = Sandwich.objects.filter(is_vegan=True)
2 for sandwich in sandwiches:
3   print(sandwich.name + " - " + sandwich.spice_level)
```

- %OPTION% line 1
- %OPTION% It depends on how many results return by query.
- %OPTION% It depends on cache.
- %OPTION% line 2

#### Q51. You are building a web application using a React front end and a Django back end. For what will you need to provision?\*\*

- %OPTION% an NGINX web server
- %OPTION% a NoSQL database
- %OPTION% a larger hard drive
- %OPTION% CORS middleware

#### Q52. To expose an existing model via an API endpoint, what do you need to implement?\*\*

- %OPTION% an HTTP request
- %OPTION% a JSON object
- %OPTION% a query
- %OPTION% a serializer

#### Q53. How would you stop Django from performing database table creation or deletion operations via migrations for a particular model?\*\*

- %OPTION% Run the `migrate` command with `--exclude=[model_name]`.
- %OPTION% Move the model definition from `models.py` into its own file.
- %OPTION% Set `managed=False` inside the model.
- %OPTION% Don't run the `migrate` command.

#### Q54. what method can you use to check if form data has changed when using a form instance?

- %OPTION% has_changed()
- %OPTION% its_changed()
- %OPTION% has_updated()
- %OPTION% None of This

#### Q55. What is WSGI?

- %OPTION% a server
- %OPTION% an interface specification
- %OPTION% a Python module
- %OPTION% a framework

#### Q56. Which generic view should be used for displaying the tittles of all Django Reinhardt's songs?

- %OPTION% DetailView
- %OPTION% TittleView
- %OPTION% SongView
- %OPTION% ListView

#### Q57. Which statement is most accurate, regarding using the default SQLite database on your local/development machine but Postgres in production

- %OPTION% There's less chance of introducing bugs since SQLite already works out the box
- %OPTION% It's fine, you just need to keep both instances synchronized
- %OPTION% It's a bad idea and could lead to issues down the road
- %OPTION% It's the most efficient way to build a project

#### Q58. Why might you want to write a custom model Manager?

- %OPTION% to perform database queries
- %OPTION% to set up a database for testing
- %OPTION% to modify the initial QuerySet that the Manager returns
- %OPTION% to filter the results that a database query returns

#### Q59. In Django, what are used to customize the data that is sent to the templates?

- %OPTION% models
- %OPTION% views
- %OPTION% forms
- %OPTION% serializers

#### Q60. To complete the conditional, what should this block of code end with?

```shell
% if sparles >= 50 %
  Lots of sparkles!
% elif sparkles == 42 %
  The answer to life, the universe, and everything!
```

- %OPTION% `% endif %`
- %OPTION% Nothing else is needed.
- %OPTION% `% end%`
- %OPTION% `% else %`

#### Q61. When should you employ the POST method over the GET method for submitting data from a form?

- %OPTION% when the data in the form may be sensitive
- %OPTION% when you want the data to be cached
- %OPTION% when you want to use your browser to help with debugging
- %OPTION% when efficiency is important

#### Q62. What is a callable that takes a value and raises an error if the value fails to meet some criteria?

- %OPTION% mediator
- %OPTION% validator
- %OPTION% regular expression
- %OPTION% deodorizer

#### Q63. You are uploading a file to Django from a form and you want to save the received file as a field on a model object. You can simply assign the file object from**\_to a field of type\_\_**in the model.

- %OPTION% request.META; FileField
- %OPTION% request.FILES; BLOBField
- %OPTION% request.FILES; FileField
- %OPTION% request.META.Files; CLOBField

#### Q64. What python module might be used to store the current state of a Django model in a file?

- %OPTION% pickle
- %OPTION% struct
- %OPTION% marshal
- %OPTION% serialize

#### Q65. To add a new app to an existing Django project, you must edit the **_ section of the _** file.

- %OPTION% ALLOWED_HOSTS; settings.py
- %OPTION% APPS; manage.py
- %OPTION% INSTALLED_APPS; settings.py
- %OPTION% TEMPLATES; urls.py

#### Q66. Which is not a third-party package commonly used for authentication?

- %OPTION% django-guardian
- %OPTION% django-rest-auth
- %OPTION% authtoken
- %OPTION% django-rest-framework-jwt

#### Q67. Which function in the django.urls package can help you avoid hardcoding URLS by generating a URL given the name of a view?

- %OPTION% get_script_prefix()
- %OPTION% redirect()
- %OPTION% reverse()
- %OPTION% resolve()

#### Q68. Which is Fictional HTTP request method?

- %OPTION% POST
- %OPTION% PUT
- %OPTION% PAUSE
- %OPTION% PATCH

#### Q69. Which helper function is not provided as a part of django.shortcuts package? ref-

- %OPTION% render_to_request()
- %OPTION% render()
- %OPTION% redirect()
- %OPTION% get_object_or_404()

[Reference](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.0/topics/http/shortcuts/#:~:text=The%20package%20django.,controlled%20coupling%20for%20convenience's%20sake)

#### Q70. Which is a nonstandard place to store templates?

- %OPTION% at the root level of a project
- %OPTION% inside the application
- %OPTION% in the database
- %OPTION% on Github

#### Q71. If you left the 8080 off the command python manage.py runserver 8080 what port would Django use as default?

- %OPTION% 8080
- %OPTION% 80
- %OPTION% 8000
- %OPTION% It would fail to start

#### Q72. Which statement about Django apps is false?

- %OPTION% A Django app is the top-level container for a web application powered by Django.
- %OPTION% Django apps are small libraries designed to represent a single aspect of a project.
- %OPTION% Each Django app should do one thing, and one thing alone.
- %OPTION% A Django project is made up of many apps.

en.TITLE: Skill Assessments Quizzes
en.DESC:
Collection of questions and answers on different subjects aimed to help
you test your knowledge before an important job interview!

Data from __data__. UI by __bandinopla__

es.TITLE: Questionarios de evaluación de habilidades
es.DESC:
Colección de preguntas y respuestas sobre diferentes temas orientadas a
ayudarte a testear tu conocimiento antes de una importante entrevista de trabajo! 

Datos de __data__. UI por __bandinopla__
